register.description: This register controls the CORE power state to reach upon a domain sleep transition

bitfield.description: OCP_WP bank and DMM bank2 state when domain is ON.

bitenum.description: Memory bank is on when the domain is ON.

bitfield.description: IPU UNICACHE bank state when domain is ON.

bitenum.description: Memory bank is on when the domain is ON.

bitfield.description: IPU L2 bank state when domain is ON.

bitenum.description: Memory bank is on when the domain is ON.

bitfield.description: OCMRAM bank state when domain is ON.

bitenum.description: Memory bank is on when the domain is ON.

bitfield.description: DMA/ICR bank and DMM bank1 state when domain is ON.

bitenum.description: Memory bank is on when the domain is ON.

bitfield.description: OCP_WP bank and DMM bank2 state when domain is RETENTION.

bitenum.description: Memory bank is off when the domain is in the RETENTION state.

bitfield.description: IPU UNICACHE bank state when domain is RETENTION.

bitenum.description: Memory bank is off when the domain is in the RETENTION state.
Memory bank is retained when domain is in RETENTION state.

bitfield.description: IPU L2 bank state when domain is RETENTION.

bitenum.description: Memory bank is off when the domain is in the RETENTION state.
Memory bank is retained when domain is in RETENTION state.

bitfield.description: OCMRAM bank state when domain is RETENTION.

bitenum.description: Memory bank is retained when domain is in RETENTION state.

bitfield.description: DMA/ICR bank and DMM bank1 state when domain is RETENTION.

bitenum.description: Memory bank is retained when domain is in RETENTION state.

bitfield.description: Power state change request when domain has already performed a sleep transition. Allows going into deeper low power state without waking up the power domain.

bitenum.description: Do not request a low power state change.
Request a low power state change. This bit is automatically cleared when the power state is effectively changed or when power state is ON.

bitfield.description: Logic state when power domain is RETENTION

bitenum.description: Only retention registers are retained and remaing logic is off when the domain is in RETENTION state.
Whole logic is retained when domain is in RETENTION state.

bitfield.description: Power state control

register.description: This register provides a status on the current CORE power domain state. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Last low power state entered. Set to 0x3 upon write of the same only. This register is intended for debug purpose only.

bitenum.description: Power domain was previously in RETENTION

bitfield.description: Domain transition status

bitenum.description: No on-going transition on power domain
Power domain transition is in progress.

bitfield.description: OCP_WP bank and DMM bank2 state status
IPU UNICACHE bank state status
IPU L2 bank state status
OCMRAM bank state status
DMA/ICR bank and DMM bank1 state status
Logic state status
Current power state status

register.description: This register contains dedicated L3_MAIN_1 context statuses. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Specify if RFF-based context has been lost due to a previous power transition or other reset source. (set upon assertion of CORE_PWRON_RET_RST signal)
Specify if DFF-based context has been lost due to a previous power transition or other reset source. (set upon assertion of CORE_RST signal)

bitfield.description: Specify if RFF-based context has been lost due to a previous power transition or other reset source. (set upon assertion of CORE_RET_RST signal)

bitfield.description: Specify if RFF-based context has been lost due to a previous power transition or other reset source. (set upon assertion of CORE_PWRON_RET_RST signal)

register.description: This register controls wakeup dependency based on OCMC_RAM1 service requests.

bitfield.description: Wakeup dependency from OCMC_RAM1 module (SWakeup signal) towards EVE4 + L3_MAIN1 + L4PER1 + L4PER2 + L4PER3 domains
Wakeup dependency from OCMC_RAM1 module (SWakeup signal) towards EVE3 + L3_MAIN1 + L4PER1 + L4PER2 + L4PER3 domains
Wakeup dependency from OCMC_RAM1 module (SWakeup signal) towards EVE2 + L3_MAIN1 + L4PER1 + L4PER2 + L4PER3 domains

Wakeup dependency from OCMC_RAM1 module (SWakeup signal) towards DSP2 + L3_MAIN1 + L4PER1 + L4PER2 + L4PER3 domains
Wakeup dependency from OCMC_RAM1 module (SWakeup signal) towards IPU1 + L3_MAIN1 + L4PER1 + L4PER2 + L4PER3 domains
Wakeup dependency from OCMC_RAM1 module (SWakeup signal) towards DSP + L3MAIN1 + L4PER1 + L4PER2 + L4PER3 domains
Wakeup dependency from OCMC_RAM1 module (SWakeup signal) towards IPU2 + L3_MAIN1 + L4PER1 + L4PER2 + L4PER3 domains
Wakeup dependency from OCMC_RAM1 module (SWakeup signal) towards MPU + L3_MAIN1 + L4PER1 + L4PER2 + L4PER3 domains

register.description: This register controls the release of the IPU2 sub-system resets.

bitfield.description: IPU system reset control.

bitenum.description: Reset is cleared for IPU CACHE and MMU
Reset is asserted for the IPU CACHE and MMU

bitfield.description: IPU Cortex M4 CPU1 reset control

bitenum.description: Reset is cleared for the IPU Cortex M4 CPU1
Reset is asserted for the IPU Cortex M4 CPU1

bitfield.description: IPU Cortex M4 CPU0 reset control.

bitenum.description: Reset is cleared for the IPU Cortex M4 CPU0
Reset is asserted for the IPU Cortex M4 CPU0

register.description: This register logs the different reset sources of the IPU2 SS. Each bit is set upon release of the domain reset signal. Must be cleared by software. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Cortex M4 CPU1 has been reset due to IPU ICECRUSHER1 reset source

bitenum.description: CPU1 has been reset upon icecrusher reset

bitfield.description: Cortex M4 CPU0 has been reset due to IPU ICECRUSHER0 reset source

bitenum.description: CPU0 has been reset upon icecrusher reset

bitfield.description: Cortex M4 CPU1 has been reset due to emulation reset source e.g. assert reset command initiated by the icepick module

bitenum.description: CPU1 has been reset upon emulation reset

bitfield.description: Cortex M4 CPU0 has been reset due to emulation reset source e.g. assert reset command initiated by the icepick module

bitenum.description: CPU0 has been reset upon emulation reset

bitfield.description: IPU system SW reset status

bitenum.description: IPU MMU and CACHE interface has been reset upon SW reset

bitfield.description: IPU Cortex-M4 CPU1 SW reset status

bitenum.description: Cortex M4 CPU1 has been reset upon SW reset

bitfield.description: IPU Cortex-M4 CPU0 SW reset status

bitenum.description: Cortex M4 CPU0 has been reset upon SW reset

register.description: This register contains dedicated L3_INSTR context statuses. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Specify if DFF-based context has been lost due to a previous power transition or other reset source. (set upon assertion of CORE_RST signal)

register.description: This register contains dedicated OCP_WP1 context statuses. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Specify if memory-based context in CORE_NRET_BANK memory bank has been lost due to a previous power transition or other reset source.
Specify if RFF-based context has been lost due to a previous power transition or other reset source. (set upon assertion of CORE_PWRON_RET_RST signal)
Specify if DFF-based context has been lost due to a previous power transition or other reset source. (set upon assertion of CORE_RST signal)
